page.title: 17BRIDGE OF WEIR - FARMLAND
page.content: The{farm land}around{B.O.W}is mainly arable land, with a bit of rough grazing.{High Auchensdale}is a dairy farm owned by{Mr.R.Carruth,}which lies S.W.of B.O.W at about{500}ft.above sea level. The house dates from{1745,}but the land has been farmed since{1923}by Mr.Carruth's family, he himself taking over from his father in{1967. There is a covering of light loam soil, which is good land if it is well fed. The size of the farm has grown from{118 acres}to{240 acres}present day, and 240 acres are also rented for summer grazing. Mr.Carruth runs the farm with the help of his wife and an agricultural student, who is there for a year prior to college. His{3}sons help on a part-time basis. Hopefully one of them will carry on the family tradition at High Auchensdale.
